00001 #ifndef _UPK_PROTOCOL_H
00002 #define _UPK_PROTOCOL_H

00004 #include "upk_error.h"
00005 #include "upk_types.h"
00006 
00007 /* ********************************************************************************************************************
00008  * enums must preserve order. To add support for a new protocol version, create a new vN interface, add whatever
00009  * additional fields necessary to a vN_protocol_structs.h and append the macro in the appropriate location here.  and
00010  * add the version specific items to the switch in upk_protocol.c. Note that the underlying protocol does _not_ need to
00011  * maintain anything as a subset; just the wrapper function must support old and new styles.  this allows for controlled 
00012  * deprecation, while still providing protocol and API compatibility.
00013  * ******************************************************************************************************************* */
00014 
00015 #define UPK_MAX_PACKET_SIZE 65536                          /* 64k should be enough for anyone */
00016 
00017 #define UPK_MIN_SUPPORTED_PROTO 0
00018 #define UPK_MAX_SUPPORTED_PROTO 0
00019 
00020 #define UPK_DATA __upk_data
00021 #define UPK_DATA_PTR __upk_data_ptr
00022 #define UPK_DATA_LEN __upk_data_len
00023 #define UPK_BUF __upk_buf
00024 #define UPK_BUF_PTR __upk_buf_ptr
00025 #define UPK_UINT8_BUFFER __upk_uint8_buf
00026 #define UPK_UINT16_BUFFER __upk_uint16_buf
00027 #define UPK_UINT32_BUFFER __upk_uint32_buf
00028 #define UPK_STRING_LENGTH __upk_string_len
00029 
00030 /* XXX you will want to redefine these depending on the type of data you're dealing with */
00031 #define UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER_TYPEDEF upk_pkttype_t
00032 #define UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER pkttype
00033 
00034 #define UPK_INIT_DESERIALIZE(TYPE) \
00035     TYPE * UPK_DATA = NULL; \
00036     unsigned char * UPK_BUF_PTR = UPK_BUF; \
00037     uint32_t UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = 0; \
00038     uint16_t UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = 0; \
00039     uint8_t UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = 0; \
00040     UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = UPK_UINT32_BUFFER + 0; \
00041     UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = UPK_UINT16_BUFFER + 0; \
00042     UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = UPK_UINT8_BUFFER + 0
00043 
00044 
00045 #define UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB) MEMB ## _len
00046 
00047 #define UPK_INIT_DESERIALIZE_MSG(TYPE) \
00048     UPK_INIT_DESERIALIZE(TYPE); \
00049     UPK_DATA = calloc(1,sizeof(*UPK_DATA)); \
00050     UPK_FETCH_ENUM(UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER_TYPEDEF, UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER)
00051 
00052 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT32_T(TYPE,MEMB) \
00053     memcpy(&UPK_UINT32_BUFFER, UPK_BUF_PTR, sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)); \
00054     UPK_DATA->MEMB = (TYPE) ntohl( UPK_UINT32_BUFFER ); \
00055     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)
00056 
00057 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT32(MEMB) \
00058     UPK_FETCH_UINT32_T(uint32_t, MEMB)
00059 
00060 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT16_T(TYPE,MEMB) \
00061     memcpy(&UPK_UINT16_BUFFER, UPK_BUF_PTR, sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)); \
00062     UPK_DATA->MEMB = (TYPE) ntohs( UPK_UINT16_BUFFER ); \
00063     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)
00064 
00065 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT16(MEMB) \
00066     UPK_FETCH_UINT16_T(uint16_t, MEMB)
00067 
00068 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT8_T(TYPE,MEMB) \
00069     memcpy(&UPK_UINT8_BUFFER, UPK_BUF_PTR, sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER)); \
00070     UPK_DATA->MEMB = (TYPE) UPK_UINT8_BUFFER; \
00071     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER) 
00072 
00073 #define UPK_FETCH_UINT8(MEMB) \
00074     UPK_FETCH_UINT8_T(uint8_t, MEMB)
00075 
00076 #define UPK_FETCH_BOOL(MEMB) \
00077     UPK_FETCH_UINT8_T(bool, MEMB)
00078 
00079 #define UPK_FETCH_ENUM(TYPE,MEMB) \
00080     UPK_FETCH_UINT32_T(TYPE, MEMB)
00081 
00082 #define UPK_FETCH_STRING(MEMB) \
00083     UPK_DATA->MEMB = calloc(1, UPK_DATA->UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB) + 1);  /* null terminate */ \
00084     memcpy(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB)); \
00085     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_DATA->UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB)
00086 
00087 #define UPK_FETCH_DATA_TO_BUF(BUF, LEN) \
00088     BUF = calloc(1, UPK_DATA->LEN); \
00089     memcpy(BUF, UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->LEN); \
00090     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_DATA->LEN
00091 
00092 #define UPK_FETCH_DATA(MEMB) \
00093     UPK_FETCH_DATA_TO_BUF(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB))
00094 
00095 #define UPK_FETCH_ARRAY(MEMB, LEN) \
00096     memcpy(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_BUF_PTR, LEN); \
00097     UPK_BUF_PTR += LEN
00098 
00099 #define UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE(TYPE) \
00100     TYPE * UPK_DATA = (TYPE *) UPK_DATA_PTR; \
00101     upk_pkt_buf_t * UPK_BUF = NULL; \
00102     upk_pkt_buf_t * UPK_BUF_PTR = NULL; \
00103     uint32_t UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = 0; \
00104     uint16_t UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = 0; \
00105     uint8_t UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = 0; \
00106     size_t UPK_STRING_LENGTH = 0; \
00107     UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = UPK_UINT32_BUFFER + 0; \
00108     UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = UPK_UINT16_BUFFER + 0; \
00109     UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = UPK_UINT8_BUFFER + 0; \
00110     UPK_STRING_LENGTH = UPK_STRING_LENGTH + 0
00111 
00112 #define UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE_BUF(TYPE, LEN) \
00113     UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE(TYPE); \
00114     UPK_BUF = calloc(1, LEN); \
00115     UPK_BUF_PTR = UPK_BUF
00116 
00117 #define UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE_MSG(TYPE) \
00118     UPK_INIT_SERIALIZE_BUF(TYPE, UPK_DATA_LEN); \
00119     UPK_PUT_ENUM(UPK_MSG_IDENTIFIER)
00120 
00121 #define UPK_PUT_UINT32(MEMB) \
00122     UPK_UINT32_BUFFER = htonl( (uint32_t) UPK_DATA->MEMB ); \
00123     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, &UPK_UINT32_BUFFER, sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)); \
00124     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT32_BUFFER)
00125 
00126 #define UPK_PUT_UINT16(MEMB) \
00127     UPK_UINT16_BUFFER = htons( (uint16_t) UPK_DATA->MEMB ); \
00128     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, &UPK_UINT16_BUFFER, sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)); \
00129     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT16_BUFFER)
00130 
00131 #define UPK_PUT_UINT8(MEMB) \
00132     UPK_UINT8_BUFFER = (uint8_t) UPK_DATA->MEMB; \
00133     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, &UPK_UINT8_BUFFER, sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER)); \
00134     UPK_BUF_PTR += sizeof(UPK_UINT8_BUFFER)
00135 
00136 #define UPK_PUT_BOOL(MEMB) \
00137     UPK_PUT_UINT8(MEMB)
00138 
00139 #define UPK_PUT_ENUM(MEMB) \
00140     UPK_PUT_UINT32(MEMB)
00141 
00142 #define UPK_PUT_STRING(MEMB) \
00143     UPK_STRING_LENGTH = strnlen(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_MAX_STRING_LEN); \
00144     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->MEMB, strnlen(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_STRING_LENGTH)); \
00145     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_STRING_LENGTH
00146 
00147 #define UPK_PUT_DATA_FROM_BUF(BUF, LEN) \
00148     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, BUF, UPK_DATA->LEN); \
00149     UPK_BUF_PTR += UPK_DATA->LEN
00150 
00151 #define UPK_PUT_DATA(MEMB) \
00152     UPK_PUT_DATA_FROM_BUF(UPK_DATA->MEMB, UPK_MEMB_TO_LEN(MEMB))
00153 
00154 #define UPK_PUT_ARRAY(MEMB, LEN) \
00155     memcpy(UPK_BUF_PTR, UPK_DATA->MEMB, LEN); \
00156     UPK_BUF_PTR += LEN

00158 #ifdef __NEVERDEFINED_NEED_FOR_AUTOSCAN_TO_SEE_FUNCS_USED_IN_ABOVE_MACROS
00159 static inline void 
00160 __never_compiled(void)
00161 {
00162     void *foo, *bar;
00163     int32_t baz = 1;
00164     foo=calloc(1,sizeof(int32_t));
00165     bar=calloc(1,sizeof(int32_t));
00166     memcpy(foo,bar,sizeof(int32_t));
00167     baz=strnlen("foobar", 64);
00168     baz = htonl(baz);
00169     baz = ntohl(baz);
00170     baz = (int32_t) htons((int16_t) baz);
00171     baz = (int32_t) ntohs((int16_t) baz);
00172 }
00173 #endif

00180 typedef unsigned char   upk_pkt_buf_t;
00181 
00182 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00183  * enums for packet type description; anything >= V0_PROTO_LIMIT is invalid * in version 0 of the protocol; future
00184  * protocol extensions may be added after V0_PROTO_LIMIT in enumeration, and terminated with V1_PROTO_LIMIT, etc. For
00185  * the sake of simplicity; these will be forced into uint32_t space; regardless of what the arch's enum size may
00186  * actually be
00187  * ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00188 typedef enum {
00189     PKT_REQUEST = 1,
00190     PKT_REPLY,
00191     PKT_PUBMSG,
00192     PKT_V0_PROTO_LIMIT,
00193 } upk_pkttype_t;
00194 
00195 typedef enum {
00196     REQ_PREAMBLE = 1,
00197     REQ_SEQ_START,
00198     REQ_SEQ_END,
00199     REQ_ACTION,
00200     REQ_SIGNAL,
00201     REQ_LIST,
00202     REQ_STATUS,
00203     REQ_SUBSCRIBE,
00204     REQ_UNSUBSCRIBE,
00205     REQ_DISCONNECT,
00206     REQ_V0_PROTO_LIMIT,
00207 } upk_req_msgtype_t;
00208 
00209 typedef enum {
00210     REPL_PREAMBLE = 1,
00211     REPL_SEQ_START,
00212     REPL_SEQ_END,
00213     REPL_RESULT,
00214     REPL_LISTING,
00215     REPL_SVCINFO,
00216     REPL_ACK,
00217     REPL_ERROR,
00218     REPL_V0_PROTO_LIMIT,
00219 } upk_repl_msgtype_t;
00220 
00221 typedef enum {
00222     PUB_PUBLICATION = 1,
00223     PUB_CANCELATION,
00224     PUB_V0_PROTO_LIMIT,
00225 } upk_pub_msgtype_t;
00226 
00227 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00228  * |----|----|----|<payload ...>|----|
00229  * ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00230 typedef struct {
00231     uint32_t                version_id;
00232     uint32_t                seq_num;
00233     upk_pkttype_t           pkttype;                       /* will be forced into a uint32_t; even on 64bit */
00234     uint32_t                payload_len;                   /* not size_t, because this would force the arch of the
00235                                                             * client to match the server */
00236     void                   *payload;
00237     uint32_t                crc32;
00238 } upk_packet_t;
00239 
00240 /* *******************************************************************************************************************
00241  * |----|----|<client_name ...>|
00242  * ****************************************************************************************************************** */
00243 typedef struct {
00244     upk_req_msgtype_t       msgtype;
00245     uint32_t                min_supported_ver;
00246     uint32_t                max_supported_ver;
00247     uint32_t                client_name_len;
00248     char                   *client_name;
00249 } upk_req_preamble_t;
